_header: The knowledge of God passeth comparison
Title(s): A Treatise bytweene Enformacione and Musyke
_description: William Cornish, A Treatise bytweene Enformacione and Musyke (A.D. 1504) — Prologue of four stanzas rhyme royal and text of twelve stanzas rhyme royal

BLHar43.First Lines:
The knowlege of god passythe comparysonethe devyle knowthe all
                    evyle thyng consentyd or done…
BLHar43.Last Lines:
…for yif he dyd then change sholde the thys songpyte for
                    pacyens & concyens for wrong
BLHar43.Note:
Imperfect; added to back flyleaves; damage to f. 88 means that third
                    stanza virtually lost; ends bottom of page on 91 recto; this version has
                    4-stanza prologue followed by sixteen stanzas rhyme royal.
BLHar43.Attributed Title:
A tretyse by twene enformacione and musyke (f. 88v after
                    prologue)

BLRoy18Dii.First Lines: The knowledge of god passith comparysonThe devill knowith all il thinge consented or done…
BLRoy18Dii.Last Lines: …ffor if he didde then change shulde this in songepitie for pacience and conscience for wronge
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Author: In the fleete maade be me William Cornysshe otherwyse called Nysshewhete Chapelman with the moost famost and noble kyng Henry the viith his raigne the xixth yere, the moneth of Iuly, a Treatise bitwene Trowth and enformacion (f. 163); Ne nysswhete parabolam (f. 164ra, in rubric)
BLRoy18Dii.Attributed Title: A. B. of E. how C. for T. was P. in P (f. 163, in rubric)
